alert.note: Alert for Custer (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 10 at 4:11PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Custer County through 500 PM CDT... At 411 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Broken Bow, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Broken Bow, Berwyn, Westerville and Buckeye. This includes the following highways... Highway 183 between mile markers 92 and 98. Highway 2 between mile markers 275 and 293. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
